data.title: Kirarin Revolution spork.
data.meta_description: Since I'm on a bit of a manga-reading kick, I've been going through my old collection and found quite a few unwanted series, such as Fushigi Yugi and From Far Away, both of which contain the normal girl travels to mysterious other world, meets hot guy, they fall in love cliche.…
data.text:
Since I'm on a bit of a manga-reading kick, I've been going through my old collection and found quite a few unwanted series, such as Fushigi Yugi and From Far Away, both of which contain the "normal girl travels to mysterious other world, meets hot guy, they fall in love" cliche. Noriko of From Far Away is an especially unlikeable character, and EVERY SINGLE COVER has a picture of her and Izark on it, with Izark in the "I will protect you, darling" pose.

But neither Noriko nor Miaka is as Sueish as... Kirari Tsukishima, of Kirarin Revolution.

Title of Work: Kirarin Revolution

Author: An Nakahara

Full Name, including titles: Kirari Tsukishima

Full Species(es): Human

Hair Colour (include adjectives): On the manga covers; something between strawberry blonde and brown. In the anime (which I have not seen because there are songs and the voice actress' voice sounds bad); a darker brown.

Eye Colour: Grey? Blue? Purple? I have NO idea, because it's so inconsistent in all the colour drawings.

Unusual Markings/Colourations: None really.

Special Possessions/Pets: A kitten named Na-san.

Annoying Sidekicks: I guess you could say the kitten is a bit of a sidekick too...

Annoying Origin: Doesn't say.

Annoying Way of Ruining the Story: Starts off as an ordinary girl but becomes a Hannah Montana-style ~POPSTAR~ by the second chapter. Has a voice actress (in the anime) who can't sing, another comparison to Hannah Montana. The target age for both series is the same though, so I wouldn't be surprised if Kirarin Revolution was inspired by mediocre Disney Channel shows/movies.

Annoying Special Abilities: Eats a lot, but maintains her figure. She falls onto stage at this pop group's concert, and is miraculously saved by a cushion right in the middle of the stage.

Miscellaneous Reasons The Sue Should Not Exist: Is annoyingly hyper. Is the prettiest girl in her school. She meets a famous heartthrob and will do ANYTHING to get into his pants. I'm not sure if he's a Gary-Stu or not, but he comes to like her pretty quickly.

Redeeming Qualities: The love of food and total apathy towards trends (in the beginning) could be a flaw, but she gets right into the latest trends as soon as people tell her about them. Nothing really is likeable about this girl. Nothing.

Small snippet of Sue Being Annoying: (Please make sure this is properly accredited to author, so we're not violating copyright).

Chapter 2 here because that's when the Sue is most annoying.
